1 # Readme
2 
3 ![gli](http://gli.g-truc.net/logo.png)
4 
5 [OpenGL Image](http://gli.g-truc.net/) (*GLI*) is a header only C++ image library for graphics software.
6 
7 *GLI* provides classes and functions to load image files (*[KTX](https://www.khronos.org/opengles/sdk/tools/KTX/)* and *[DDS](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/bb943990%28v=vs.85%29.aspx)*), facilitate graphics APIs texture creation, compare textures, access texture texels, sample textures, convert textures, generate mipmaps, etc.
8 
9 This library works perfectly with *[OpenGL](https://www.opengl.org)* or *[Vulkan](https://www.khronos.org/vulkan)* but it also ensures interoperability with other third party libraries and SDK.
10 It is a good candidate for software rendering (raytracing / rasterisation), image processing, image based software testing or any development context that requires a simple and convenient image library.
11 
12 *GLI* is written in C++11. It is a platform independent library with no dependence and it supports the following compilers:
13 - [Apple Clang 4.0](https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/CompilerTools/Conceptual/LLVMCompilerOverview/index.html) and higher
14 - [GCC](http://gcc.gnu.org/) 4.6 and higher
15 - [Intel C++ Composer](https://software.intel.com/en-us/intel-compilers) XE 2013 and higher
16 - [LLVM](http://llvm.org/) 3.2 and higher
17 - [Visual C++](http://www.visualstudio.com/) 2010 and higher
18 - Any conform C++11 compiler
19 
20 For more information about *GLI*, please have a look at the [API reference documentation](http://gli.g-truc.net/0.8.0/api/index.html).
21 The source code and the documentation are licensed under the [Happy Bunny License (Modified MIT) or the MIT License](./doc/copying.md).
22
